DataElement.preferredName: Intravenous Contrast Agent Test Bolus Infusion Performed Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to indicate if a test dose was administered intravenously.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Intravenous Contrast Agent Test Bolus Infusion Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: (in-tra-VEE-nus) IV. Within a blood vessel._Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue._A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something._A single dose of drug usually injected into a blood vessel over a short period of time._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (in-tra-VEE-nus) IV. Within a blood vessel.:Substances used in radiography that allow visualization of certain tissues.

Concepts.definition: Into or within a vein. Intravenous usually refers to a way of giving a drug or other substance through a needle or tube inserted into a vein.

Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue.

Property.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.:A single dose of drug usually injected into a blood vessel over a short period of time.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.
A procedure in which a single dose of a pharmalogical substance is administered, generally via injection, over a short period of time.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
